en: This portrait of a Lady is smaller than the average miniature by Oliver, however the assured execution and fine detailing does not give this fact away. It is in very good condition despite the moderate fading and the consistent tarnishing of the silver used for the highlight on the pearls and the jewels on the pendant, and only small retouched areas are evident around the border and in the hair (see raking light and UV images).

The orange UV fluorescence in the lace, pearls and eyes is due to the use of lead white. A pink UV fluorescence in the lips suggests the presence of organic dyes.

The mercury MA-XRF map highlights the use of vermilion to outline the hair of the sitter. Mercury is also associated with the silver, as evident in the pearls and pendant in the (HG) MA-XRF map.
